intro: Ochrocephala imatongensis, commonly known as the Imatong grasshopper plant, is a species of flowering plant native to South Sudan. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in lowland areas with rich soil. Its botanical features include small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters, making it a distinctive member of its family.
